intro: Piqueria latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf piqueria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are broad and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Piqueria latifolia is often used in traditional medicine and is also an important plant for pollinators.
